Phiiip Morris is very pleased by a ruling today issued by U.S:

Judge Jones granted a
motion filed by Philip Morris and the other defendants to allow
them to pursue an
immediate appeal to the Fifth Circuit Court of Appeals oi his decision to certify certain
common issuos for class handling:
Charles Wall; senior vice president and associate general counsel at Philip
Morris, applauded {he decision , saying it was tha ccmmon-sense way to manage the
litigation.
This case presents many important legal issues that will inevitably be decided
by the Fifth Circuit, and it makes sense to have these issues decidcd now, before both
sides embark o longthy and costly pretrial proceedings and preparation;'
Wall
said.

motion to stay all proceedings in the
trial court until thc Fitth Circuit has rulod on the issue of class certification:

individual issues predominate_
Philip Morris and the cther defendants now plan to ask
the Fifth Circuit to decertify the Castano class.
